text:
A Painter's Dilemma

Dimly lit room, tense atmosphere  
Raskolnikov: “You can’t improve a boy by pushing him away.”  

Nastasya: “What do you mean?”  
Raskolnikov: “We’re helping a house-painter.”  

---  

Dark thoughts swirl, Raskolnikov pensive  
Nastasya: “Lizaveta was murdered, too!”  
Raskolnikov: “Lizaveta...”  

Nastasya: “You knew her, right? She mended your shirt.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The conversation reveals a connection between a house-painter and a murder case involving an old pawnbroker and another victim, Lizaveta.
